New Records: Willy Adames hit his 29th home run of the season, tying Ken Griffey Jr.'s MLB record of 13 three-run home runs in a single season.
Adames has now hit 13 three-run home runs in 2024, matching Griffey's record from 1996.
Key Match Events: Willy Adames blasted a 371-foot three-run home run in the bottom of the first inning, giving the Brewers an early lead.
The Brewers went on to defeat the St. Louis Cardinals 9-3.
Pre-Game Insights: Adames entered the game on a streak of five consecutive games with home runs, three of the last four being three-run shots.
Post-Match Reflections: The Brewers' victory marked a significant moment in their season, with Adames' performance being a key factor.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Adames' impressive season has made him a highly sought-after player, with his contract set to expire this fall.
The game concluded with a final score of 9-3 in favor of the Brewers.
